intro: Ardisia iteophylla, commonly known as the Chinese evergreen, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Myrsinaceae and is characterized by its glossy, dark green foliage. The plant produces small, white to pinkish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its berries are typically red or orange when mature and contain several seeds. Ardisia iteophylla is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and ability to thrive in shaded environments.
